intro: Oreocharis auricula var. denticulata, commonly known as the denticulate auricula, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
